data.value: If you want to ask Ginger about Fuse, I'd suggest you hurry. It looked like she was preparing to leave town for a while. Good luck!
They were helping the Moonbloods, of course. Helping the enemy is a treasonous offense. Ginger escaped, but her parents and her brother did not.
Regardless, I can't thank you enough for putting a stop to that mad beast before he came any closer to Aurora.
Not... personally. His is not a name we utter here without proper cause. I've never seen him or his soldiers personally, but tragedy tends to follow in their wake.
So why did they kill Ginger's family?
Her family was killed almost a year ago in Zeplich Village, a few days' journey to the north. General Gaius and his soldiers were looking for Moonblood sympathizers.
A lizard, you say? A Moonblood, perhaps. I wonder if Ginger would know anything about that.
General Gaius? Do you know who he is?
Oh no... That could only be Denham Village. Did you find any survivors?
Ginger? That girl up on the hill?
Waiting?
I'm sorry, Mayor Bram, but there were none. This creature that attacked the village, he was some kind of lizard. Wore strange armor. Called himself Fuse.
Aha! It's great to see you back, son! I knew you could do it! The monsters have already calmed their advance. Tell me, what happened? Did you confront their leader?
In the middle of a small village, surrounded by the innocents he killed.
He was right where you said he'd be. In fact, he seemed to be waiting for us.
If he gives you trouble with fire, you know what they say!
Fight fire with fire?
You know, I tried that once. Nearly burned down my house. Come to think of it, fighting fire with fire is a terrible idea. You shouldn't ever do that. Ever.
Please, come back in one piece, Dust. You seem capable enough, but I could never live with myself if this somehow got you killed.
I wouldn't be able to live with that, either, Mayor Bram. I'll do my best.
This one does. There are stories that the creature is actually MADE of fire, but I imagine it's just an exaggeration.
I've got a feeling there's more truth to that than either of us would like.
We don't know much about their leader, but he has a penchant for fire.
I wasn't aware these creatures even knew how to make fire.
Regardless, there must be some reason those monsters follow him. Please, be careful.

The watchmen reported increased monster activity to the east of our village, so I imagine that's where you should go. But do be careful - strong as you may be, I've seen many fine warriors lose their lives to these monstrosities.
I understand, Mayor. I'll be careful. And I'll be back.
Alright, Mayor Bram, you've convinced us. We'll do what we can to help stop these attacks.
That's my boy!
It certainly would cripple their advance. You'd be doing the entire village a great service.
Well, I...
How about it, Dust?
Helping this village is the right thing to do... but it's more than that. It's almost like... like I know these people. Like I have to help them.
You feel a conflict of emotions. This is good. I will abide by your decision, Master. I trust you to take the right path.
Charming as always, Fidget.
I think that strange feeling you've got is a little foreign concept called "compassion". I'm proud of you, Dust! Of course, if you'd said no, I'd need to bite your face off.
I think you've made a wise decision.
Well, whatever it is, it's become a serious problem. If you truly are as capable as I hear...
You want us to find their leader?

Then perhaps we can help each other. If you help our village, I promise I'll do whatever I can to help you, but I can be of no assistance while our village is constantly attacked by these creatures. We suspect their leader is close-by, and if you could-...
Whoa whoa whoa, hold on a second! You're saying those mindless thugs have a leader?
Yet again with the modesty! You're no mere travelers, that much I've gathered. Mineral merchants don't wield blades as impressive as yours, Dust. Please - we really could use the help.
I don't know. I'm searching for something myself.
Our land, I imagine.
Just a casual observation, but they don't seem the farming type.

Until recently, they would attack us in small groups - nothing we couldn't handle. Now they coordinate attacks on a much larger scale, hitting the village on both sides, driving our forces apart. I assure you, whatever leads these things is experienced in warfare.
What do they want?
Don't concern yourself. We have other matters to discuss.
What help could I possibly provide? A few giants in a field seem like the least of your problems.

No need to be modest, my friend! We can't thank you enough for your help. Things have been rough in Aurora of late, so having a true hero in our midst is really boosting morale. So, what's your name, son?
Good day! I'm Mayor Bram. So, you're the hero I've been hearing about!
Dust. My name is... Dust. And some of the villagers I've met... they don't seem quite as pleased as you.
Yes, that could only be Ginger. She can be a bit of a handful, but don't pass judgement on her like that. You have no idea what she's gone through this past year.
It's nothing, really. We're just passing through.

Ah, are you talking about the watchmen? You must understand, hardly a day goes by without some monstrosity attacking our peaceful village. They were simply being cautious. Take my word, I'm sure they meant no ill will.
She looked pretty upset about something.
There was also this girl...
Thank you Dust, we are indebted to you for your help. Best of luck on your quest.
